intro: Zephyranthes cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It is a bulbous plant that produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers during the rainy season. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded or partially shaded environments. Its flowers are short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and moths. Zephyranthes cochabambensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and its ability to bloom reliably in suitable conditions.
